extendedIngredients.name: buffalo wing sauce
extendedIngredients.originalString: ¼ to ½ cup wing sauce ( depending on how hot you like your wings!)
metaInformation: ( depending on how you like your wings!)

extendedIngredients.name: celery
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 stalks celery, sliced in half length-wise then sliced
metaInformation: sliced in half length-wise then sliced

extendedIngredients.name: shredded chicken
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 cups cooked chopped or finely shredded chicken.

recipes.title: Chicken Wing Soup

winePairing.pairingText: Chicken can be paired with Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Sauvignon Blanc. White meat is typically paired with white wine as to not overpower the flavor of the meat, so chardonnay and sauvignon blanc are safe choices. Chicken prepared with a tomato sauce or certainly a red wine sauce can and should be served with a red like a pinot noir. The District 7 Estate Chardonnay with a 5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 18 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: District 7 Estate Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Our 2012 vintage has aromas of tropical fruit and butterscotch that lead into a lively blend of pear, pineapple and citrus flavors

recipes.instructions: Saute celery in butter over medium high heat for about 5 minutes. Stir in chicken broth ( leave out a splash to mix with the cornstarch) and bring to a boil.In a small bowl or cup stir together cornstarch and a splash of cold chicken broth. When broth comes to a boil stir in chicken, heavy cream and cornstarch mixture. Continue to boil, stirring constantly for one minute.Reduce heat and stir in hot wing sauce and blue cheese, stirring until cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

steps.step: Saute celery in butter over medium high heat for about 5 minutes. Stir in chicken broth ( leave out a splash to mix with the cornstarch) and bring to a boil.In a small bowl or cup stir together cornstarch and a splash of cold chicken broth. When broth comes to a boil stir in chicken, heavy cream and cornstarch mixture. Continue to boil, stirring constantly for one minute.Reduce heat and stir in hot wing sauce and blue cheese, stirring until cheese is melted.
